intro: Astragalus cronquistii, commonly known as the Cronquist's milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems, compound leaves, and small, yellowish-pink flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, harsh environments. Astragalus cronquistii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
